p: The scientific literature reports few chemical and biological studies carried out on these native species. In the case of S. aspera, there is a work that evaluates the leishmanicidal properties of the plant extracts [ 6]. For S. macrotepala a chemical study denotes the presence of cadinane-sesquiterpenes [ 7]. Regarding P. augustum, an investigation of the chemical composition of the essential oil, isolated from its leaves, reports α-phellandrene (14.7%), β-caryophyllene (13.5%), limonene (13.0%), α-pinene (10.5%) and linalool (10.3%) as main components [ 8]. A second study assessed its anti-leishmanial activity [ 9]. For P. leticianum, no investigations have been found.
